storyInfo: Eblana falls, but the purple fire in the city burns even fiercer. Loughshinny, Nemos, and Brigid each take their own action... Here ends the second story.

attributes.content: How far is County Hillock?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Far.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: My sister must have known...
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Only The Elocutionist and his band of idiots would consider this plan flawless.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Then why are you still following me?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Oh, believe me, if it were up to me I'd be taking a nap in camp right about now.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Why didn't my sister stop me?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: I don't know. Maybe she has high hopes for you.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: No, that's impossible. She's never looked at me like that. When I agreed to be her shadow, she...
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Please, Harmonie... tell her I don't want to do this.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: That you don't want to go to County Hillock?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Mhm. And if she's in a good mood, could you also tell her that, from now on, I'llâ€”
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: No, never mind.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Fine, can't hurt to pass it along, I suppose. Although it's not easy avoiding The Elocutionist's eyes and ears.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Thank you. You should go...
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: ...before she gets bored.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.text: Harmonie did not return until after they arrived at County Hillock. She knew what that meant.
That night, when cannons roared and crystals bloomed, she lay on the streets of County Hillock, blood draining from her abdomen.
She had not been afraid then. Instead, she felt relieved that she would die like any other person.
But then she saw those purple flames, on a tower not too far away.
That was when she felt afraid.
Afraid that the flames would overlook her and turn her into another puppet like those on the street.
Afraid that the flames would find her and bring her back, forcing her to remain a shadow.
She gazed into the fire, trying to find some hint of her future in it, but saw nothing but apathy.
That which she feared most had finally happened.

attributes.content: The dead dragon lies on the ground.
Behind the living dragon, the wayward wakewoman suddenly understands it all.
She deceived you.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: No, she didn't deceive anyone.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: She set this all up, knowing you would never allow the entire city to die with her!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: She baited you into piercing her vessel, freeing her from her bonds and allowing the purple fire to spread, burning us all to ashes on the eve of Samhain!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Why would she take such a risk for a festival that she never cared about?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I'm affected by the purple flames too. I can feel the flames of death burning in my chest, colder than ever. So cold I'm growing number by the minute!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: It doesn't matter whether she's seeking dominion over all of Tara, or if she's simply gone mad and wants the city to die with her!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: It's neither. Tara already belongs to her, and she was very much lucid. She...
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Sheâ€”
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Nemos, is her body still there?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I'll go check.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: The wayward wakewoman's brow is furrowed. Perhaps she has never felt such malice in all her life, and as such has never harbored such resolve.
Her body isâ€”
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: The sound of burning drowns out her answer.
Whatever she's trying to do, Na SaoirsÃ­ is not fully gone. The fire-returning ceremony can still go on... it must go on.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I'm well aware.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I'll inform the citizens that the wicked red dragon they worshipped is dead.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: What about Brigid?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I've asked her to leave the city and find the wakemen.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: And how are you going to tell people that Eblana is dead?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: With a coffin. That seems appropriate.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Even coffins are in short supply, but she is not some nameless nobody. She deserves one.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Is something wrong?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: No. I'm simply realizing how ugly the path she walked is, a path that even now waves at me invitingly... And it's an invitation I have no choice but to accept.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Go, Nemos. I will buy you some time.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: You mean from the dark mist?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Yes. If it wants to be a part of the Samhain festivities, I will keep it at bay.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I can hardly wait to ask the mist how to return the Red Dragon's flame to darkness.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: 'I can hardly wait to ask the mist how to return the Red Dragon's flame to darkness.'
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: How do you feel about that line?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Now, the ending of the dragon and her reflection is clear enough.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: The writer stands up with a start.
Who are you and what do you want?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: All I want is to finish the story that you would not.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Didn't you say I was the type who liked to piece together the truth? We've gotten so very close to it.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: This is enough. I'm leavingâ€”
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: If you won't tell the ending yourself, I suppose it falls on me.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.text: Suddenly, someone opened their eyes, causing a surprised reflection to let go of her hand. The dragon fell into the fire burning bright, and the reflection hid back in the mirror.
When the fire subsided, the dragon was gone, and the people were anxious, for they could not find their dragon.
The reflection wanted to explain, find a way to bring the dragon back. Without the dragon, though, she could no longer leave the mirror.

attributes.content: What do you think?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: You've been glancing over there at the newspapers. But not everything reported is a fact.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: The writer looks towards the door.
He tries to imagine himself running out of the tavern, but it is such a preposterous proposition that he almost laughs out loud.
If not everything reported is a fact, then he finally knows who this woman is, and why she is here.
He also knows that there is no escape.
But there is something else he realizes.
Perhaps this is his chance to truly find the ending he had hoped for.
No matter who she is, as long as the story continues, they are equals.
He feels his spirit return.
Okay. I don't care who you are, or why you're here, but that's no way to tell a story.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: You haven't given it an ending. All you did was extend an ending-less story.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: But I have to knowâ€”did you... really see a red dragon kill another?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: In the same sense that you saw the hero drag a giant metal skeleton to the square. A creative liberty, nothing more.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Then take responsibility for it. So the dragon in the mirror accidentally caused her other self to burn to death in the fire. What next? What did the people do? What about the dragon in the mirror?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: What about you? Don't you have any ideas of your own?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: For the first time in a long while, the writer takes out a fountain pen from his pocket, then grabs one of the playing cards on the table. He tries to write something, but the tip of the pen has dried out from disuse.
I need... time.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: But if it can be connected... then maybe...
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Connected?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Let me guess. You're talking about the last story that you published?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: The writer's pen scratches hard against the card. Finally, some ink oozes out of the tip.
He is suddenly reminded of the words of Seamus Williamsâ€”'May death connect us with all legends.'
Seamus Williams is dead. But he himself mightâ€”if he may be so impertinentâ€”have a chance to be connected with the legends he wrote.
He tries to scribble the poem on the card, but the pen leaves only broken, illegible ink trails.
Just maybe...
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: The writer sits back on the chair, his back even straighter than before.
He suddenly feels an urge, the same one he felt after hearing a Seamus Williams poem for the first time.
The same feeling that had taken him down this wretched path, which seizes his chest and makes him want to sing, to yellâ€”
To create.
You may have indeed solved a problem for me.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: As I said, what I've seen, what I believe, and what I've said all contradict one another. Thanks to you, though, they are finally beginning to converge.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: How lovely for you.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Now, are you ready to start telling the third story?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Of course... of course.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: But I'll need your help.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: You will need to pick up the narrative whenever I get stuck.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: This is my story, but it's also yours.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: It has always been yours.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: With pleasure.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: The writer's breathing is rapid, his face red. His fountain pen still refuses to write, so he throws it on the table.
Yes. Of course.
Has he not seen enough of those things already?
So what?
He is a writer. He will soon find the ending of his story.
